videoSnippet.title: 2 is Better Than 1
videoSnippet.description:
Photos by Lennart Ootes
Have a great day :)

Nepomniachtchi, Ian (2792) - Firouzja, Alireza (2778)
Sinquefield Cup (chess24.com) [2] 2022.09.03
E04 Catalan, open, 5.Nf3

1.d4 Nf6 2.c4 e6 3.Nf3 d5 4.g3 dxc4 5.Bg2 a6 6.O-O Nc6 7.Qc2 Nxd4 8.Nxd4 Qxd4 9.Nd2 c3 10.bxc3 Qc5 11.Ne4 Nxe4 12.Bxe4 Bd6 13.Rb1 f5 14.Bg2 O-O 15.Be3 Qa5 16.c4 f4 17.Bd4 Be5 18.Qb2 Bxd4 19.Qxd4 e5 20.Qd5+ Qxd5 21.Bxd5+ Kh8 22.Bxb7 Rb8 23.Bxc8 Rfxc8 24.Rfd1 Kg8 25.Rxb8 Rxb8 26.Rd5 Rb4 27.Rxe5 fxg3 28.hxg3 Rxc4 29.Ra5 Rc6 30.Kg2 Kf7 31.f4 Ke7 32.e4 Rb6 33.Kf3 Rc6 34.f5 Kf7 35.g4 h6 36.Kf4 Ke7 37.Ra4 Rb6 38.Rc4 Kd8 39.e5 Rb1 40.Rc6 Rb4+ 41.Kf3 Rb5 42.Ke4 Rb4+ 43.Kd5 Rxg4 44.Ke6 Kc8 45.Rxa6 Kb7 46.Ra3 Rg2 47.Kf7 Rf2 48.f6 Kc6 49.Kxg7 Kd7 50.Kf7

Niemann, Hans Moke (2688) - Mamedyarov, Shakhriyar (2757) 
Sinquefield Cup (chess24.com) [2] 2022.09.03
A28 English, four knights, Nimzovich variation

1.c4 e5 2.Nc3 Nf6 3.Nf3 Nc6 4.e4 Bc5 5.Nxe5 Nxe5 6.d4 Bb4 7.dxe5 Nxe4 8.Qf3 Nxc3 9.bxc3 Ba5 10.Bf4 O-O 11.O-O-O Qe7 12.Kb2 Rb8 13.Qe3 b6 14.Bd3 Qe6 15.Qg3 Re8 16.Rhe1 b5 17.c5 b4 18.c4 b3 19.axb3 Bxe1 20.Rxe1 a5 21.Bd2 Ba6 22.Qh4 g6 23.Qd4 Rb7 24.Bxa5 Reb8 25.b4 Rxb4+ 26.Bxb4 Rxb4+ 27.Kc3 Rb8 28.Be4 Qe8 29.Bd5 Bb7 30.Rb1 Ba8 31.Rxb8 Qxb8 32.Bxa8 Qxa8 33.Qxd7 Qa1+ 34.Kb4 Qxe5 35.Kb5 h5 36.Kc6 Qxh2 37.Qd8+ Kh7 38.Qf6 Qxg2+ 39.Kxc7 Qe4 40.Qxf7+ Kh6 41.Qd5 Qe7+ 42.Kb6 Qf6+ 43.c6 Qxf2+ 44.Kb7 Qb2+ 45.Qb5 Qg2 46.Kb8 h4 47.c7 Qg3 48.Kb7 Qf3+ 49.Qd5 Qb3+

00:00 Hello Everyone!
00:59 Game 1 Starts
03:10 Completely New Game
09:00 It Was in this Position!
09:58 Sorcery!
10:30 Game 2 Starts
12:25 Completely New Game
22:20 It Was in this Position!
24:00 Standings!
25:45 Contributions!

The Sinquefield Cup is a 10-player classical round-robin taking place in the Saint Louis Chess Club from 2-11 September 2022. It's the fifth and final stage of the 2022 Grand Chess Tour, a series of five events with a total prize fund of $1.4 million.

The players receive 90 minutes for 40 moves, followed by 30 minutes to the end of the game, plus a 30-second increment starting from move one. Official website: grandchesstour.org
